channel.title: How do I fix Firemaking?
channel.description: Firemaking seems to be a broken skill with Divine PK V5.0, and I was wanting to know if anyone knows how to fix the skill so it works.

item.title: How do I fix Firemaking?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Zian, post:14, topic:236771”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312542.msg2492455#msg2492455 date=1224201171]

Zian if you don’t even know the file to edit, you won’t know how to edit it.

id assume its UseInvItemOnGroundItem if demonik had a handler for that.

Just because I don’t know what file to open to edit it does not mean I can’t edit it, I can some what read/understand java coding. I am doing this to learn java coding and hopefully make a working RSC server!
[/quote]Reading and pretending to understand java code is easy. Real coding, like fixing this, requires real java knowledge not pretend “Oh I can read player.getClient.sendmessage(”");, it must mean that it sends a message because it says it does!" Learn java first, don’t try coding a game without knowing the language first. That’s like flying a plane without knowing how to fly a plane.

Ok then is there any other coding I should learn before I learn Java?

Also just to make sure, is it called Java coding? NOT Java script right?

Any books you would recommend or websites I can learn Java coding from? I know about w3schools.com but they have Java script and I believe that is the incorrect coding.[/quote]

Read full topic

Real coding, like fixing this, requires real java knowledge not pretend “Oh I can read player.getClient.sendmessage(”");, it must mean that it sends a message because it says it does!" Learn java first, don’t try coding a game without knowing the language first. That’s like flying a plane without knowing how to fly a plane.

Any books you would recommend or websites I can learn Java coding from? I know about w3schools.com but they have Java script and I believe that is the incorrect coding.[/quote]Yes, it’s java not javascript. Javascript is web, java is non-web… http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/index.html[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 16, 2008, 08:02:32 pm[/size][hr][quote=“hasumon, post:13, topic:236771”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312542.msg2492455#msg2492455 date=1224201171]

id assume its UseInvItemOnGroundItem if demonik had a handler for that.

Just because I don’t know what file to open to edit it does not mean I can’t edit it, I can some what read/understand java coding. I am doing this to learn java coding and hopefully make a working RSC server!
[/quote]Reading and pretending to understand java code is easy. Real coding, like fixing this, requires real java knowledge not pretend “Oh I can read player.getClient.sendmessage(”");, it must mean that it sends a message because it says it does!" Learn java first, don’t try coding a game without knowing the language first. That’s like flying a plane without knowing how to fly a plane.

No not really. Its called copying from another server that has it working and paste it into your own.[/quote]This is rsc, that’s not how things work here.

item.title: How do I fix Firemaking?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:6, topic:236771”][quote author=Zian link=topic=312542.msg2491254#msg2491254 date=1224125564]

Yah, dropping was removed from divine due to dupes.

Oh so I have to drop the log to light it on fire?
[/quote]

Hi Zian and welcome to Runescape Classic

This game is a MMORPG with lots of new stuff to see and almost similar to real life!!

For example:- When you want to make a fire, you take the tinderbox and light your bag on fire…Oh wait!!

YOU HAVE TO DROP THE LOGS INORDER TO START THE FIRE

you really didnt know that?[/quote]

No I did not know that, I only played RS2. Because by the time I joined RS, RSC was for members only. and in RS2 you don’t have to drop the logs to light them on fire. could you please tell me the file to edit so I can drop logs on the ground that way firemaking can be a skill that I can raise?

Read full topic

[/quote]

Oh so I have to drop the log to light it on fire?[/quote]

Hi Zian and welcome to Runescape Classic

This game is a MMORPG with lots of new stuff to see and almost similar to real life!!

For example:- When you want to make a fire, you take the tinderbox and light your bag on fire…Oh wait!!

YOU HAVE TO DROP THE LOGS INORDER TO START THE FIRE

you really didnt know that?

item.title: How do I fix Firemaking?
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

Ok found it, I am a little confused in reading it. Because it is not as clear to me as the fletching thing was… But the file name is InvUseOnItemEvent.java

package com.rscd.event;

import com.rscd.util.DataConversions;
import com.rscd.DelayedEventHandler;
import com.rscd.model.*;
import com.rscd.entityhandling.EntityHandler;
import com.rscd.entityhandling.defs.GameObjectDef;
import com.rscd.entityhandling.defs.extras.*;
import com.rscd.util.Formulae;

public class InvUseOnItemEvent extends WalkToPointEvent 
{
	private Item groundItem;
	private InvItem item;
	final private World world = World.getWorld();
	
	public InvUseOnItemEvent(Player owner, Item groundItem, InvItem item) 
	{
		super(owner, groundItem.getLocation(), 0);
		this.groundItem = groundItem;
		this.item = item;
	}

	public void showBubble() 
	{
		Bubble bubble = new Bubble(owner, item.getId());
		
		for(Player p : owner.getViewArea().getPlayersInView()) 
			p.informOfBubble(bubble);
	}

	public void arrived()
	{
		if(!owner.getInventory().contains(item) || !World.getWorld().getTile(groundItem.getLocation()).hasItem(groundItem) || owner.isBusy()) 
		{
			owner.resetPath();
			return;
		}
		
  		switch(item.getId()) 
  		{
  			case 166: // Tinderbox
  			{
  				if(groundItem.getID() == 14) // Logs - firemaking
  				{
  					if(world.getTile(owner.getLocation()).hasGameObject())
  					{
  						owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You can't start a fire here!");
  						return;
  					}
  					
  					showBubble();
  					owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You attempt to light the logs with your " + item.getDef().getName() + "...");
  					owner.setState(MobState.DOING_ACTION);
  					
  					world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedEvent(owner, 1000)
  					{
  						public void run() //26.75
  						{
  							if(Formulae.lightLogs(1, owner.getCurStat(11)))
  							{
	  							owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("The fire catches and the " + groundItem.getDef().getName() + " start to burn");
	  							final GameObject fire = new GameObject(owner.getLocation(), 97, 0, 0);
	  							world.registerGameObject(fire);
	  							owner.incExp(11, 27);
	  							owner.getActionSender().sendStat(11);
	  							
	  							world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ObjectRemover(fire, 90000));
	
	  							world.unregisterItem(groundItem);
  							} else
  							{
  								owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("The fail to light the logs.");
  							}
  							
  							owner.setState(MobState.IDLE);
  							stop();
  						}
  					});
  				}
  			}
  		}
  		
  		owner.getActionSender().sendInventory();
	}
	
	public boolean equals(Object o) 
	{
		if(o instanceof InvUseOnItemEvent) 
		{
			InvUseOnItemEvent e = (InvUseOnItemEvent)o;
			return e.belongsTo(getOwner()) && e.getGroundItem().equals(getGroundItem()) && e.getItem().equals(getItem());
		}
		return false;
	}
	
	public Item getGroundItem() 
	{
		return groundItem;
	}
	
	public InvItem getItem()
	{
		return item;
	}
}

Just to clear up this question I got, how do you light logs on fire? do you have to drop them then use the tinderbox on them? or can use just use the tinderbox on the logs while they are in your inventory. If you have to drop them to light them on fire that is not currently possible for me… Because when I drop items they just disappear.

Read full topic
